content:
Mixed and decomposed Unicode characters are not CLS-compliant

Only composed UNICODE characters are allowed in public, protected, or protected``internal identifiers in order to be compliant with the Common Language Specification (CLS). For more information on CLS Compliance, see Writing CLS-Compliant Code and Language Independence and Language-Independent Components.
